MANUAL: apt-file5-equivalent (1.18.2)

apt-file5-equivalent will check to see if two HDF5 files contain equivalent values.

This can be annoying to do with a regular diff as differences in precision and compiler rounding errors can lead to representational differences for two numbers that are equivalent (i.e. 1.0 == 0.99999981).

Quick Start

To compare HDF5 binary files file1.a5 and file2.a5, use:

apt-file5-equivalent -d datasets.tsv -i setIgnore.txt -e 0.001 -c 0.9999 file1.a5 file2.a5

Options:

apt-file5-equivalent - check to see if two HDF5 files contain equivalent values.

This can be annoying to do with a regular diff as differences in 
precision and compiler rounding errors can lead to representational 
differences for two numbers that are the same (i.e. 1.0 == 0.99999981).

usage:
   apt-file5-equivalent -epsilon 0.001 -c 0.9999 file1.cychp file2.cychp

options:
   -h, --help                           This message. [default 'false'] 
   -i, --ignore-columns-file Path to TSV file with list of columns to
                          ignore.
                           (One column with header line 
                          IgnoreColumns) [default ''] 
   -d, --datasets-file Path to TSV file with list of datasets to
                          compare.
                           (Two columns with header line GroupName
                          TsvName) [default ''] 
   -e, --epsilon Epsilon tolerance to differences. [default
                          '.001'] 
   -c, --correlation Correlation tolerance to differences.
                          [default '1.0'] 
   -v, --version Display version information. [default
                          'false'] 
   -n, --report-nan-num-diff Report differences between NaN and non-NaN
                          values. [default 'false'] 
   -s, --sign-allow-negation Allow sign difference between pairs of
                          values compared.
                           [default 'false']
